Talent.Description: Once per session perform a [B]Hard ([DI] [DI] [DI]) Lightsaber check[b] to decrease the difficulty of all Negotiation checks for the rest of the encounter by 2.

Talent.Name: Soresu Technique
Talent.Description: When making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may use Intellect instead of Brawn.

Talent.Name: Combat Programming
Talent.Description: Once per encounter make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] while repairing or working on a droid. For the remainder of the encounter, the droid gains 1 rank in two different combat skills.

Talent.Name: Construction Specialist
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] equal to ranks in Construction Specialist from checks to construct defenses, positions, fortifications, and similar projects.

Talent.Name: Creative Design
Talent.Description: As part of resolving a successful crafting check, the character may also apply a result equivalent to spending a number of [AD] equal to his ranks in Creative Design. The GM may then apply a result equivalent to spending that same number of [TH].

Talent.Name: Desperate Repairs
Talent.Description: Once per session may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] on one engaged allied droid. If successful, the droid becomes immobilized and staggered for 1 round, then heals all strain and one Critical Injury with a severity rating no greater than [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Talent.Name: Design Flaw
Talent.Description: When making a combat check with a personal scale weapon against a droid, may add [AD] equal to ranks of Design Flaw.

Talent.Name: Dockyard Expertise
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b] when at a space dock, if successful, the cost and time for repairs is reduced by 25% per rank of Dockyard Expertise.

Talent.Name: Improvised Defenses
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Survival check[b] to fashion small defenses. It providing cover for up to 4 characters for the rest of encounter.

Talent.Name: Improvised Position
Talent.Description: The character may make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to construct a secure position. This provides cover for the group and its vehicles.

Talent.Name: Master Demolitionist
Talent.Description: When resolving an attack from a personal explosive or ordnance weapon, may spend [AD] or [TR] to have the weapon's Blast quality act at short range, or medium if it already acts at short.

Talent.Name: Push the Specs
Talent.Description: Perform the Push the Specs action when in a starship or vehicle, making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. With success, the ship's top speed increases by 1 for a number of rounds equal to the characters Intellect.

Talent.Name: Repair Patch Specialization
Talent.Description: Whenever using an emergency repair patch, the target heals an additional wound per rank of Repair Patch Specialization.

Talent.Name: Smart Handling
Talent.Description: Once per session, take the Smart Handling action; making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. Until the start of the next round the ship's handling increases by 2 plus an amount equal to [AD] scored on the check to a maximum handling of +4.

Talent.Name: Weak Foundation
Talent.Description: Once per session may take the Weak Foundation action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b], if successful, for the remainder of the encounter the character and all allies add automatic [AD][AD] or [SU] to all combat checks made targeting the identified fixed structure.

Talent.Name: Acklay's Scything Strike
Talent.Description: Brawl attacks gain Pierce equal to Force rating.

Talent.Name: Dodge (Improved)
Talent.Description: After using Dodge, can make a Move maneuver as an out-of-turn incidental.

Talent.Name: Far Strike
Talent.Description: As an action, make a Brawl check as a ranged attack, adding [FO] up to Force rating, increase the range of the attack by one band for each [FP] spent, to a maximum of long.

Talent.Name: Headbutt
Talent.Description: Perform Headbutt incidental, suffering 2 wounds to knock down and disorient enemy.

Talent.Name: Indomitable Will
Talent.Description: Once per encounter as a maneuver, suffer 3 strain to commit [FO] up to Force rating and reduce all damage suffered by an equal amount, but suffer 1 strain per turn.

Talent.Name: Inner Peace
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, convert a number of dark side Destiny Points equal to ranks in Inner Peace to light side Destiny Points and reduce Conflict gained this session.

Talent.Name: Juyo Savagery
Talent.Description: Enter description for Talent "Juyo Savagery" here.

Talent.Name: Power from Pain
Talent.Description: Once per session as an incidental, may spend 1 Destiny Point to gain +1 Force rating for each Critical Injury character is suffering until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Sapith Sundering
Talent.Description: May add [FO] up to Force rating to Brawl checks; the attack gains the Sunder quality, and character may spend [FP] generated one the check as [AD] to activate the Sunder quality.

Talent.Name: Toughened (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session, may heal wounds equal to ranks in Toughened,

Talent.Name: Vaapad Control
Talent.Description: When making a Lightsaber combat check, the character may suffer 1 strain to downgrade the difficulty of this check a number of times equal to the number of light side Destiny Points in the Destiny pool.

Talent.Name: Embrace Your Hate
Talent.Description: May spend 1 Destiny Point and suffer Conflict equal to dark side Destiny Points in pool to add equal damage to melee attack. May use this ability once per encounter per rank.

Talent.Name: Alchemical Arts
Talent.Description: After making a check to craft a potion or talisman, may suffer strain up to twice ranks in Alchemical Arts. For every two strain, add [LI] or [DA] to results.

Talent.Name: Blooded (Improved)
Talent.Description: As an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] to immediately recover from all poisons and side-effects of drugs. Reduce difficulty once per rank of Blooded.

Talent.Name: Channel Agony
Talent.Description: After rolling [FO], may suffer wounds up to twice ranks in Channel Agony to add automatic [DA] for every two wounds suffered to the results.

Talent.Name: Font of Power
Talent.Description: Once per session, may take the Font of Power action. Until the end of the encounter, characters within medium range add automatic [LI] or [DA] to checks based on alignment.

Talent.Name: Identify Ingredients
Talent.Description: After being exposed to a substance, as an out-of-turn incidental, may roll [FO] no greater than Force rating. Spend [FP][FP] to immediately identify its composition and effects.

Talent.Name: Improvised Concoction
Talent.Description: Once per session, as an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Xenology) check[b], adding [FO] no greater than Force rating to create 1 dose of a poison or drug with rarity of Intellect + [SU] + [FP] spent or lower.

Talent.Name: Overwhelming Aura
Talent.Description: Commit [FO]. Add [AD] to social checks equal to [FO] committed. Add [TH] to equal [FO] committed to enemy social checks in short range.

Talent.Name: Overwhelming Aura (Improved)
Talent.Description: Characters affected by Overwhelming Aura add automatic [FA] to fear checks the character causes and automatic [SU] to fear checks not caused by the character.

Talent.Name: Power of Darkness
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform the Power of Darkness maneuver. Increase wound threshold and strain threshold by 1 per Dark Side Destiny point currently in the Destiny pool until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Secret Lore
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank or Secret Lore from all Knowledge (Lore) checks. Reduce the difficulty of all Knowledge (Lore) checks by 1.

Talent.Name: Transmogrify
Talent.Description: When making a crafting check, may add [FO] no greater than Force rating. Spend [FP] to add [SU] and spend [FP][FP] to add [AD] to check.

Talent.Name: Altered Deal
Talent.Description: Once per session may take the Altered Deal action and make [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Coercion check[b] to radically change a previously made deal or bargain to the character's advantage.

Talent.Name: Combat Veteran
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] to his Brawl and Discipline checks equal to his ranks in Combat Veteran.

Talent.Name: Comrades in Arms
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, take Comrades in Arms action and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Discipline check[b]. If successful, the character plus one ally per [SU] within medium range gains +1 defense for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Comrades in Arms (Improved)
Talent.Description: Spend [AD][AD][AD] or [TR] from Comrades in Arms check to also gain +1 soak or give one affected ally +1 soak.

Talent.Name: Disciple of Lore
Talent.Description: Once per round, may suffer 1 strain to decrease the difficulty of nest Knowledge (Lore) check a number of times equal to ranks in Disciple of Lore.

Talent.Name: Disciplined Soul
Talent.Description: Spend one Destiny Point after making a Discipline check to spend a number of [TH] not exceeding ranks in Knowledge (Lore) as [AD].

Talent.Name: Disorienting Strike
Talent.Description: After failing a Lightsaber combat check, may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] to disorient opponents for three rounds.

Talent.Name: Double-Talk
Talent.Description: The character may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] from a successful Charm or Deception check to disorient a number of opponents within short range equal to his Presence for remainder of round and next two rounds.

Talent.Name: Extended Reach
Talent.Description: While armed with a two-handed melee weapon, may suffer one strain to make a Melee combat check with that weapon targeting an enemy at up to short range (rather than engaged range).

Talent.Name: Fearsome Rep
Talent.Description: Add automatic [AD] to the results of Coercion checks equal to ranks in Fearsome Rep.

Talent.Name: Formation Tactics (Improved)
Talent.Description: The difficulty of Formation Tactics is reduced to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b]. May spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD][AD][AD][AD] to have effect last until the end of encounter.

Talent.Name: Inspiring Leadership
Talent.Description: Take the Inspiring Leadership action by making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, a number of allies not exceeding his rating in Presence within short range add automatic [SU] to their next skill check.

Talent.Name: Most Impressive
Talent.Description: Spend [TR] from any skill check to allow a number of allies not exceeding the character's rating in Presence within short range to add automatic [AD] to their next check.

Talent.Name: Persistent Targeting
Talent.Description: After making one or more successful combat checks against a target, add [BO] to combat checks against that same target for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy
Talent.Description: Choose one starship or vehicle character owns with a silhouette or 4 or higher; it becomes his 'Pride and Joy' vessel. He upgrades the ability of all social skill checks he makes while within short range of the vessel once.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy (Improved)
Talent.Description: While inside his Pride and Joy vessel, recover 1 additional strain whenever recovering strain and spend [AD] on checks made to recover strain to allow an ally also within the vessel to recover one strain.

Talent.Name: Pride and Joy (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When inside his Pride and Joy vessel, once per session as an incidental, the character may reduce its silhouette by 2 (to a minimum of 0) for the remainder of the round and the following round.

Talent.Name: Push Aside
Talent.Description: After making a successful Melee, Brawl, or Lightsaber combat check against an engaged foe, may force the foe to move to short range in a direction of the opponent's choosing. Spend [TR] to cause the opponent to fall prone after moving.

Talent.Name: Seen A Lot of Things
Talent.Description: Whenever the character fails a Knowledge check, he may spend [AD][AD][AD] to roll the check again during his next turn.

Talent.Name: Steady Aim
Talent.Description: The character does not lose the benefits of the Aim maneuver if he performs other maneuvers (including moving) or actions. He does lose the benefits of the Aim maneuver if the encounter ends.

Talent.Name: Targeted Firepower
Talent.Description: Once per session may take Targeted Firepower action; identify one enemy target and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b]. If successful, for the rest of the encounter allies within short range of character add [AD] to attacks against target equal to [SU] gained in the check.

Talent.Name: Temple Training
Talent.Description: Before making a Lightsaber skill check, the character may spend one Destiny Point to add damage to the attack equal to his ranks in Knowledge (Lore).

Talent.Name: Trust No One
Talent.Description: When targeted by a social check, may choose to suffer one strain to add automatic [FA] to the check. If the check fails with [DE], the character may immediately perform a maneuver as an out-of-turn incidental.

Talent.Name: By the Book
Talent.Description: Once per encounter before making a combat check, the character may suffer two strain to add [AD] to the results equal to his ranks in By the Book.

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Jedi (Improved)
Talent.Description: Discipline becomes a career skill. Secrets of the Jedi may also be used when installing mods on lightsabers.

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Jedi
Talent.Description: Lightsaber becomes a career skill. He may also decrease to difficulty of checks made to construct or repair lightsaber hilts a number of times equal to half his ranks in Knowledge (Lore) (rounded up), to a minimum of [B]Easy ([DI])[b].

Talent.Name: Knows the Ropes
Talent.Description: Add [BO] to checks made to escape from restraints equal to ranks in Knowledge (Underworld). Spend [TR] to free all other allies withing short range.

Talent.Name: Know the Enemy
Talent.Description: The character may use Knowledge (Warfare) skill when making checks to determine Initiative.

Talent.Name: As the Force Wills It
Talent.Description: May make an [B]Easy ([DI]) Knowledge (Lore) check[b] to heal strain at the end of an encounter. [TR] can be spent to heal all strain.

Talent.Name: Trust the Captain
Talent.Description: May take the Trust the Captain action by making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, for the rest of the encounter allies within short range increase their ranks in Discipline by an amount equal to ranks in Trust the Captain.

Talent.Name: Stimpack Specialization
Talent.Description: Stimpacks heal 1 additional wound per rank of Stimpack Specialization.

Talent.Name: Prepare to be Boarded!
Talent.Description: Once per encounter may take Prepare to be Boarded! action and make [B]opposed Coercion vs. Discipline check[b] against enemy ship captain. If successful, the enemy suffers 1 strain per uncancelled [SU] and surrenders ship if he exceeds strain threshold. May also spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD][AD] to inflict strain equal to ranks in Coercion.

Talent.Name: Hidden Storage (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may use Hidden Storage to store an item within his own suitably modified body.

Talent.Name: Bad Cop
Talent.Description: May spend [AD][AD] from a Deception or Coercion check to upgrade ability of a single ally's subsequent Social Interaction check against the target a number of times equal to ranks in Bad Cop.

Talent.Name: A Step Ahead
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may suffer 2 strain in order to count his Cunning as one higher than normal for the remainder of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Analyze Data
Talent.Description: Once per session after capturing enemy data, the character may perform the Analyze Data action to make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b]. Once during the remainder of session he may then add [SU] equal to ranks in Knowledge (Warfare) to one check related to that data.

Talent.Name: Cunning Persona
Talent.Description: The character may suffer 2 strain to perform a Charm check with Cunning instead of Presence.

Talent.Name: Exhaustive Questioning
Talent.Description: Whenever a character makes a successful social skill check against a captured enemy within short range, may reduce that enemy’s strain threshold by 2 for the remainder of the session and can spend [AD] to inflict 1 strain.

Talent.Name: Incite Distraction
Talent.Description: While in a crowd, may perform the Incite Distraction action to make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Deception check[b]. If successful, enemies treat the area as difficult terrain. The character may spend [TR] to make the location impassable terrain to them instead.

Talent.Name: Indistinguishable (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may extend the effects of Indistinguishable to a number of allied within short range equal to ranks in Deception.

Talent.Name: Inside Knowledge
Talent.Description: Once per session while in an enemy facility or vessel, may perform the Inside Knowledge action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check[b]. Character may then find a single personal scale item with a rarity no greater than Cunning plus 2 previously stashed here, or gain a narrative benefit.

Talent.Name: Inside Person
Talent.Description: Once per session the character may spend a Destiny Point to establish he has been undercover in an identified enemy base or large vehicle. For the remainder of the session, add automatic [AD][AD] to checks he or his allies make that are associated with that location.

Talent.Name: Know Their Weakness
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform the Know Their Weakness action and choose one target within close range; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to downgrade the difficulty of social skill checks against target once per rank of Know Their Weakness until the end of the session.

Talent.Name: Know Their Weakness (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may extend the effects of Know Their Weakness to a number of enemies within short range equal to his Presence.

Talent.Name: Lose Them
Talent.Description: When being followed or chased, the character may perform the Lose Them action and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Stealth check[b]. If successful, add [SE][SE] to checks to follow him for the remainder of the encounter and may spend [TR] to indicate his pursuers have lost him completely.

Talent.Name: Made You Talk
Talent.Description: Once per session, may make an opposed social skill check against a captured enemy character within short range and add [BO] for every 2 strain inflicted on the target that encounter. If successful, the PCs gain a bonus based on the enemy NPC type.

Talent.Name: Resist Questioning
Talent.Description: When targeted by an opposed social skill check, the character may suffer 2 strain to perform the Resist Questioning out-of-turn incidental, adding [SE] to the check. If the check fails, may spend [DE] to indicate he has provided false information to foe.

Talent.Name: Resist Questioning (Improved)
Talent.Description: When one ally within short range is targeted by an opposed social skill check, the character may perform Resist Questioning to affect this check instead. If the check fails, may spend [DE] to indicate the ally provided false information to foe.

Talent.Name: Pilot Training
Talent.Description: Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) become career skills.

Talent.Name: Adaptable
Talent.Description: When resolving a check that uses a skill in which they have no ranks, the character may spend one Destiny Point to remove [DE] or to remove [TH] equal to their ranks in Cool

Talent.Name: Another's Treasure
Talent.Description: the condition of an item does not affect its sale price. In addition, the character can always find a buyer for an item, no matter its condition or apparent value

Talent.Name: Assault Drop
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may perform the Assault Drop incidental to allow allies to embark or disembark from a vehicle or ship they are piloting as an incidental

Talent.Name: Backroom Deal
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Negotiation check[b] to reveal how previously unknown dealings have a meaningful impact on the current scene

Talent.Name: Barrel Roll
Talent.Description: when piloting a vehicle or starship of silhouette 3 or less, when hit by an attack, suffer 3 system strain to reduce the damage of one hit by ranks in Piloting

Talent.Name: Barrel Roll (Improved)
Talent.Description: when the character takes the Barrel Roll incidental, reduce the damage of all hits of the attack by ranks in Piloting

Talent.Name: Barrel Roll (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When using Barrel Roll against certain weapons may spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] to inflict once hit on an enemy vehicle within close range, dealing base damage of the original attack

Talent.Name: Beginner's Luck
Talent.Description: Once per session when the character makes a check, may add [SU] equal to the number of light side Destiny Points in the Destiny pool to the results

Talent.Name: Blather
Talent.Description: Take the Blather action, making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Charm or Deception check[b]. If successful, one adversary per [SU] is Disoriented for rounds equal to the character's Presence. The character may spend [TR] from the check to Stagger one affected target

Talent.Name: Bound Together
Talent.Description: Perform the Bound Together maneuver. Until the character's next turn, when the character or an ally within short range suffers strain involuntarily, they reduce the amount by the current number of lightside Destiny Points

Talent.Name: Brace (Improved)
Talent.Description: When the character performs the Brace maneuver they may choose one environmental circumstance. The benefits of Brace apply to that circumstance until the end of the encounter

Talent.Name: Brace (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When the character performs the Brace maneuver the benefits apply to all allies within short range

Talent.Name: Center Of Being (Supreme)
Talent.Description: When the character performs the Center of Being maneuver, the effects apply to ranged attacks as well

Talent.Name: Consider Our Options
Talent.Description: Take the Consider Our Options action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Negotiation check[b]. Until the character's next turn, a character who attacks them first suffers 2 strain, plus 1 strain per [SU][SU] on the character's check

Talent.Name: Consider Our Options (Improved)
Talent.Description: Allies within short range may also benefit from Consider Our Options

Talent.Name: Coven
Talent.Description: May take the Coven maneuver. On the character's next Force power check, they may reroll one [FO] for each ally with Coven within short range

Talent.Name: Cruel Commander
Talent.Description: May use ranks in Coercion to upgrade Mass Combat checks instead of ranks in Leadership

Talent.Name: Death From Above
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, inflict 1 system strain on jetpack and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Piloting check[b]. For each [SU], one adversary in short range is knocked prone. May spend [TR] to stagger one affected target

Talent.Name: Diplomatic Immunity
Talent.Description: As an out-of-turn incidental, the character spends one Destiny Point and adversaries cannot choose them as a target of a combat check until the end of their next turn

Talent.Name: Droid Commander
Talent.Description: Once per encounter may perform Field Commander as a maneuver instead of an action. All affected allies must be droids

Talent.Name: Enduring Presence
Talent.Description: Once per session the character may upgrade a Mass Combat check even if the character is not present or is prevented from communicating with their troops

Talent.Name: Exceed Specifications
Talent.Description: When making a check using an item, may add [BO]. The GM may spend [TH][TH] on the check to damage the item one step, or [DE] to damage it beyond usability

Talent.Name: Exceed Specifications (Improved)
Talent.Description: When the character takes the Exceed Specifications incidental, upgrade the ability of the check once instead of the standard effect

Talent.Name: Exceed Specifications (Supreme)
Talent.Description: If a check benefiting from Exceed Specifications generates [TR], may damage the item to roll additional [PR] and add it to the check results. If the check generates [DE], add [CH] to the check results

Talent.Name: Exemplar of the Republic
Talent.Description: Add [FO] to mass combat checks up to Force rating and spend [FP] to add [SU] or [AD] to the result

Talent.Name: Fall Back
Talent.Description: While engaged with an opponent, the character may suffer a number of strain up to their Leadership to allow an equal number of allies engaged with threat opponent to immediately disengage as an out of turn incidental

Talent.Name: Fire Support
Talent.Description: After the character makes a successful combat check using a vehicle weapon the next ally to make a check adds [BO] equal to ranks of Fire Support

Talent.Name: Fire When Ready
Talent.Description: Take the Fire When Ready action make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. Choose a number of crew equal to Presence who downgrade the difficulty of their next Gunnery check once, plus once per additional [SU][SU]

Talent.Name: First Among Brothers
Talent.Description: When the character makes a check that does not generate any [TH], the check gains [AD] equal to ranks in First Among Brothers. The character may only spend these additional [AD] to affect allied clones

Talent.Name: Flows Through All Things
Talent.Description: The character may perform a maneuver to recover strain equal to their Force rating

Talent.Name: For The Republic
Talent.Description: When an ally is incapacitated or killed, the character can make a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, the ally is not defeated until the end of the following round.

Talent.Name: Get The Drop
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character and any number of allies in the encounter may add [SU] equal to the character's rank in Stealth to their checks to determine initiative

Talent.Name: Guardian of the Republic
Talent.Description: After the character uses Parry or Reflect to reduce damage to an ally, that ally cannot be targeted by combat checks for the remainder of the round

Talent.Name: Hit And Run
Talent.Description: After the character completes an attack targeting an opponent they are engaged with, they may immediately move to short range using a jetpack

Talent.Name: Hyperspace Assault
Talent.Description: The character may use Astrogation or Knowledge(Warfare) to determine initiative during an encounter in which they are piloting or commanding a starship and may spend [TR] from the check to choose the starting location of allies

Talent.Name: Ichor Blade
Talent.Description: The character chooses one Melee or Brawl weapon they possess, which gains the Cortosis and Pierce 2 qualities and reduces its critical rating by 1 to a minimum of 1. If the weapon is lost or destroyed, the character can apply Ichor Blade to a new weapon

Talent.Name: Ichor Blade (Improved)
Talent.Description: The chosen weapon also gains the Sunder quality and Defensive 1 quality and increases its damage by 2

Talent.Name: Ichor Reserve
Talent.Description: Once per session as a maneuver, the character may suffer 2 strain to increase Force rating by 1 until the end of the encounter

Talent.Name: Ichor Transfusion
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, the character may perform the Ichor Transfusion maneuver to heal any number of strain by suffering that number of wounds +1. The character may instead heal any number of wounds by suffering that number of strain +1

Talent.Name: Ingrained Loyalty
Talent.Description: When the character makes a Leadership check targeting one or more clones, they may change the result of one [CH] to any non-blank face

Talent.Name: Inspiring Kill
Talent.Description: The character may spend 1 Destiny Point to take the Inspiring Kill maneuver after incapacitating or inflicting a Critical Injury. Roll [FO] no greater than force Rating and spend [FP] to heal 2 strain from each ally within medium range

Talent.Name: Jetpack Expertise
Talent.Description: The character may spend [AD] from their checks to remove 1 system strain from their jetpack. They may choose the effect multiple times when spending [AD]

Talent.Name: Knowledge is Strength
Talent.Description: Once per session when making a check, the character may increase their Force rating by their ranks in Knowledge(Warfare)

Talent.Name: Known Programming
Talent.Description: Once per session, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Vigilance check[b] to upgrade the difficulty of a certain droid model's check against the character, plus one ally per [SU] after the first, once for the rest of the encounter

Talent.Name: Known Programming (Improved)
Talent.Description: Allies affected by Known Programming also upgrade the ability of their checks targeting the chose droid model once

Talent.Name: Lateral Thinking
Talent.Description: Once per encounter spend one Destiny Point to force an enemy to reroll a successful check targeting the character. does not require a Destiny Point if the enemy is a droid

Talent.Name: Lead From The Back
Talent.Description: Once per round, may spend 1 Destiny Point to redirect a successful attack against the character to an allied NPC

Talent.Name: Lead From the Front
Talent.Description: After succeeding on a Leadership check or other check to inspire, lead, or rally an audience, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point to upgrade the ability of the next combat check made by all allies within short range

Talent.Name: Learning Opportunity
Talent.Description: Once per round, the character may spend [AD][AD][AD] from a check they fail to upgrade the ability of their next check once.

Talent.Name: Leverage
Talent.Description: The character removes [SE] per rank of Leverage from their Cool and Negotiation checks

Talent.Name: Master Of The Order
Talent.Description: The character can spend 2 Destiny Points during a single action

Talent.Name: Mission Critical
Talent.Description: Once per session after rolling a Piloting (Planetary) or Piloting(Space) check but before resolving it, the character may spend a Destiny Point to add [SU] or [AD] to the results equal to their ranks in that skill

Talent.Name: Momentum
Talent.Description: The character deals additional damage to their first hit equal to the number of range bands they moved during the current round

Talent.Name: Natural Champion
Talent.Description: Once per session may reroll any 1 Leadership or Lightsaber check

Talent.Name: Natural Commando
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may reroll one Ranged (Light) or Stealth check

Talent.Name: Natural Operator
Talent.Description: Once per session may roll any 1 Piloting (Planetary) or Piloting (Space) check

Talent.Name: Natural Trooper
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any one Gunnery of Ranged (Heavy) check

Talent.Name: Nobody's Fool {Improved)
Talent.Description: May spend [TR] or [TH][TH] from an incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception check to inflict strain on the opponent equal to the character's ranks in Nobody's Fool

Talent.Name: On My Order
Talent.Description: As an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check.[b] Choose a number of crew equal to Presence who upgrade the ability of their next Gunnery check once plus once per additional [SU][SU]

Talent.Name: One Person's Trash
Talent.Description: May make a Perception check in order to locate a particular item at no cost in a location with potential salvage. The difficulty of the check is determined by the item's rarity

Talent.Name: Ordnance Saturation
Talent.Description: When the character or certain allies activate the Blast quality of a planetary scale weapon, all ships or vehicles within close range of the target suffer damage equal to the weapon's blast quality

Talent.Name: Outmaneuver
Talent.Description: As an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge(Warfare) check.[b] Choose one ship or vehicle per [SU]. Until the end of the character's next turn, the chose ships must perform one extra maneuver to move

Talent.Name: Powerful Ally
Talent.Description: The character may spend a Destiny Point to use the basic version of a Force power they have not purchased or apply the effects of a control upgrade to a power they have purchased

Talent.Name: Practiced Strategist
Talent.Description: Once per session, make an [B]opposed knowledge(Warfare) check[b] against a leader of enemy forces to gain a narrative advantage

Talent.Name: Preemptive Intervention
Talent.Description: Immediately after an opponent moves to engage an ally within short range, the character may spend one Destiny Point to engage that opponent as an out of turn incidental

Talent.Name: Rapid Fire
Talent.Description: May add the Autofire item quality to a Ranged (Light) combat check. After resolving the attack, the weapon runs out of ammo

Talent.Name: Ravage
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, may suffer 3 strain to add [FO] up to their Force rating to a combat check targeting an engaged opponent, then may spend [FP] to add [SUCCESS] or [AD] to the results.

Talent.Name: Ravage
Talent.Description: Once per encounter, the character may suffer 3 strain to add [FO] up to their current Force rating to a combat check targeting an engaged opponent. the character may spend [FP] to add [SU] or [AD] to the results of the check

Talent.Name: Renegade Form
Talent.Description: When the character purchases this talent, they choose one characteristic. they may use this characteristic in place of Brawn when making Lightsaber checks.

Talent.Name: Resource Allocation
Talent.Description: At the beginning of a Mass Combat, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Charm or Negotiation check[b] to increase their force's strength by one step for the duration of the encounter. May spend [TR] from the check to upgrade the ability of their force's first Mass Combat check

Talent.Name: Respected Delegate
Talent.Description: Downgrade the difficulty of social checks made to interact with government institutions outside of homeworld a number of times equal to ranks in Respected Delegation

Talent.Name: Savvy
Talent.Description: The character adds [BO] to Charm and Negotiation checks per rank of Savvy

Talent.Name: Scrap 'Em
Talent.Description: On a successful attack, may suffer 2 strain and select allies up to ranks in Leadership who add [BO] to attacks against the target until the character's next turn

Talent.Name: Scrap 'Em (Improved)
Talent.Description: Scrap 'Em! effects twice the number of allies and allies add [BO][BO] to combat checks against the target

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Force
Talent.Description: Knowledge[Lore] and Lightsaber become career skills for the character

Talent.Name: Secrets of the Force
Talent.Description: Knowledge (Lore) and Lightsaber become career skills

Talent.Name: Side By Side
Talent.Description: While the character and one or more engaged allies are wielding lightsabers, add [TH] to all combat checks that target the character or the allies.

Talent.Name: Side Step (Improved)
Talent.Description: Whenever the character performs a Side Step maneuver, until the start of their next turn they may spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] from an attacker's check to inflict one hit with a ranged weapon they are wielding.

Talent.Name: Sincerest Flattery
Talent.Description: Once per encounter when the character makes a check using a skill that another character has previously used during the encounter, they add [BO][BO]

Talent.Name: Something to Prove
Talent.Description: Once per session, suffer 4 strain to reroll a failed check. if the succeeds the character heals 4 strain

Talent.Name: Stand Firm!
Talent.Description: As an action, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. Choose one ally per [SU] who increase their wound threshold by the character's Presence until the end of the encounter

Talent.Name: Stand Firm! {Improved}
Talent.Description: Stand Firm action also increase affected allies strain threshold by an amount equal to the character's Presence rating

Talent.Name: Summon Item
Talent.Description: As a maneuver, the character can summon or dismiss a ritually prepared item

Talent.Name: Survivor's Instincts
Talent.Description: Once per session when the character suffers a Critical injury spend 1 Destiny Point. Then the attacker must roll two results for the Critical Injury and the player choose which will apply to their character

Talent.Name: Tactical Advance
Talent.Description: The character may suffer 2 strain to perform the Tactical Advance incidental. Until the end of the character's next turn, the character and allies within short range may leave cover and continue to receive its benefits

Talent.Name: Tactical Advance (Improved)
Talent.Description: The character may spend [AD][AD] from any check they make or [TH][TH] from a combat check targeting them to perform the Tactical Advance Incidental instead of suffering strain

Talent.Name: Tactical Evasion
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of ranged combat checks targeting the character a number of times equal to the number of maneuvers they performed to move during this round

Talent.Name: Tactical Planning
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may substitute a Knowledge(Warfare) skill check for another skill check

Talent.Name: There Is No Try
Talent.Description: Once per session before an ally rolls the dice for a check, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point to allow the ally to automatically succeed at the check with one [SU] ad no other results

Talent.Name: To The Death
Talent.Description: Once per session, suffer strain up to Willpower and add a +10 per strain suffered to critical rolls the character inflicts or suffers until the end of the encounter

Talent.Name: Translation Error
Talent.Description: Once per encounter the character may remove [TH] from the results of a social skill check they make

Talent.Name: Utility Belt (Improved)
Talent.Description: Once per session when the character performs a Utility Belt Incidental, They may produce up to five functionally identical items

Talent.Name: Will of the Force
Talent.Description: Once per round after failing a skill check, the character may convert one dark side Destiny Point to a light side Destiny Point

Talent.Name: Witchcraft
Talent.Description: The character gains Force Rating 1

Talent.Name: Adaptable
Talent.Description: When resolving a check that uses a skill in which they have no ranks, the character may spend one Destiny Point to remove [DE] from the check or to remove [TH] equal to their ranks in Cool from the check.

Talent.Name: To the Death!
Talent.Description: Once per session, the character may take the To the Death! maneuver, suffering strain no greater than their Willpower rating. For each strain suffered this way, add +10 to Critical Injury rolls the character inflicts and suffers until the end of the encounter.

Talent.Name: Death from Above
Talent.Description: Once per encounter while using a jetpack, the character may take the Death from Above action, inflicting 1 system strain on their jetpack and making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])piloting (planetary) check[b]. If the check is successful, for each [SU], one adversary of silhouette 0 or 1 within short range is knocked prone. The character may spend [TRIUMPH] from the check to stagger one affected adversary until the end of that adversary's next turn.

Talent.Name: Clanker Killer
Talent.Description: Before rolling a combat check that targets a droid, remove [BO] up to character's ranks in Clanker Killer from the pool and add an equal number of [SU] or [AD] to the results

Talent.Name: Clanker Killer (Improved)
Talent.Description: Decrease the critical rating of Brawl and melee attacks targeting droids by 1 per rank of Clanker Killer, to a minimum of 1

Talent.Name: Conditioned
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Conditioned from Athletics and Coordination checks. Reduce the damage and strain suffered from falling by 1 per rank of Conditioned.

Talent.Name: At Any Cost
Talent.Description: May suffer a Critical Injury to reroll a Mass Combat check. At GM's discretion, may sacrifice an item or individual of personal significance instead

Talent.Name: Formation Tactics
Talent.Description: May take the Formation Tactics action by making a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check[b]. If successful, he may choose a number of allies within short range equal to [SU] generated. Upgrade the difficulty of attacks against these allies once until the end of his next turn.
